name: All-knowing Greaves
description: Greaves set with countless eyes and ears. Worn by Gideon Ofnir, the All-Knowing. Knowledge begins with the recognition of one's ignorance. The realization that the search for knowledge is unending. But when Gideon glimpsed into the will of Queen Marika, he shuddered in fear. At the end that should not be.

name: All-knowing Armor
description: Armor set with countless eyes and ears. Worn by Gideon Ofnir, the All-Knowing. Knowledge begins with the recognition of one's ignorance. The realization that the search for knowledge is unending. But when Gideon glimpsed into the will of Queen Marika, he shuddered in fear. At the end that should not be.

name: All-knowing Helm
description: Helm set with countless eyes and ears. Worn by Gideon Ofnir, the All-Knowing. Knowledge begins with the recognition of one's ignorance. The realization that the search for knowledge is unending. But when Gideon glimpsed into the will of Queen Marika, he shuddered in fear. At the end that should not be.

name: Alberich's Robe (altered)
description: Lighter version of the Mad Tongue Alberich's robe.

name: All-knowing Armor (altered)
description: Lighter version of the All-knowing Armor.

name: Aristocrat Coat
description: Tanned leather coat adorned with fine gold embroidery. Travel attire worn by nobles in the capital, and the belonging of a family which claims a knight as an ancestor. Abandoning their birthplace after the Shattering, these undead wanderers are the pitiful product of unending life.

name: Aristocrat Garb
description: High quality garb adorned with fine golden embroidery. Travel attire worn by nobles in the capital. Terribly faded and tattered. Abandoning their birthplace after the Shattering, these undead wanderers are the pitiful product of unending life.

name: Aristocrat Garb (altered)
description: Lighter version of the Aristocrat Garb.

name: All-knowing Gauntlets
description: Gauntlets set with countless eyes and ears. Worn by Gideon Ofnir, the All-Knowing. Knowledge begins with the recognition of one's ignorance. The realization that the search for knowledge is unending. But when Gideon glimpsed into the will of Queen Marika, he shuddered in fear. At the end that should not be.

name: Alberich's Robe
description: Mad Tongue Alberich's robe.

name: Azur's Glintstone Robe
description: A robe reserved for grant masters at the Academy of Raya Lucaria. Corroded by blue-green glintstones.

name: Battlemage Robe
description: Robe worn by scholars of the Raya Lucaria Academy scholar, tattered from being worn on the battlefield.

name: Banished Knight Armor (altered)
description: Lighter version of the Banished Knight Armor.

name: Astrologer Robe
description: Robe fashioned from supple cloth. Worn by those who look to the cosmos above. They read fate in the stars, and are said to be heirs of the glintstone sorcerers. But alas, the night sky no longer cradles fate.

name: Bandit Garb
description: Leather garb worn by bandits.

name: Astrologer Robe (altered)
description: Lighter version of the Astrologer Robe

name: Beast Champion Armor
description: Silver armor engraved with tiny beasts. Worn by Bernahl the Recusant. Beasts are drawn to champions, and to lords. And this armor befits a champion worthy of becoming a lord. And that is what Bernahl was. Until his maiden threw herself into the fire.

name: Black Knife Armor
description: Scale armor used by the Black Knife Assassins, forged to make no sound. Traces of power yet remain in its concealing veil, which muffles the sound of footsteps. The assassins that carried out the deeds of the Night of the Black Knives were all women, and rumored to be Numen who had close ties with Marika herself.

name: Beast Champion Armor (altered)
description: Lighter version of the  Best Champion Armor

name: Banished Knight Armor
description: Thick, full set of armor covering the entire body. This armor was worn by knights who, whether by misfortune or misdeed, were forced to abandon their homes. These fierce warriors were each and all accomplished. Perhaps that is why, despite their territorial losses, they were still named knights.

name: Black Knife Armor (altered)
description: Lighter version of the Black Knife Armor

name: Bloodsoaked Tabard
description: Padded cloth armor with indelible bloodstains around the neck. Worn by headless foot soldiers who endlessly guard the Wandering Mausoleum.

name: Bloodhound Knight Armor (altered)
description: Lighter version of the Bloodhound Knight Armor

name: Blaidd's Armor (altered)
description: Lighter version of the Blaidd's Armor

name: Bloodhound Knight Armor
description: Metal armor with a jutting breastplate.  Worn by the Bloodhound Knights.

name: Blackflame Monk Armor
description: Black iron armor adorned with ashen cloth.

name: Blaidd's Armor
description: Well-worn black armor of the man-wolf Blaidd

name: Blue Silver Mail Armor (altered)
description: Lighter version of the Blue Silver Mail Armor

name: Blue Festive Garb
description: Ceremonial garb worn by dancers at the festivities in Dominula, the village of windmills. Use of this garb, dyed in a stunning blue, is only permitted for the young maids who play the central role in the festival.

name: Blue Cloth Vest
description: Vest of a nomadic warrior. The blue color of its fabric symbolizes brisk waters, as fluid and flowing as the sword in the hand of its wearer. Just as still waters turn foul, stagnation leads to decay. Warriors must remain ever drifting.

name: Blue Silver Mail Armor
description: Chainmail armor crafted with blue silver. Worn by the wolf-riding Albinauric archers. Blue silver is a metal born from the same mother as the archers themselves, and provides protection from magic and frost.

name: Brave's Battlewear
description: Battlewear fashioned from leather armor adorned with a large sheet of cloth. Garb worn by warriors of the frigid uplands The red cloth signifies participation in the Long March long, long ago and this ceremonial garb beseeches the favor of the Warrior King who led them.

name: Briar Armor (altered)
description: Lighter version of the Briar Armor

name: Carian Knight Armor
description: Armor of the enchanted knights that once served the Carian royal family. The enchanted knights, anointed by the Lunar Queen, were heroes of the highest honors, but fell into disarray with the decline of the royal family.

name: Briar Armor
description: Battered iron armor from a foreign land. Worn by Elemer of the Briar.

name: Carian Knight Armor (altered)
description: Lighter version of the Carian Knight Armor

name: Brave's Battlewear (altered)
description: Lighter version of the Brave's Battlewear

name: Chain Armor
description: Armor made of woven chain. Standard issue for ordinary soldiers. Though plain in appearance, it offers dependable protection.

name: Champion Pauldron
description: Pauldron reserved for the badlands' bravest. Proof that the wearer has slaughtered countless foes. Following the example of their chieftain Hoarah Loux, the brave warriors of the badlands shun excess adornment.

name: Bull-goat Armor
description: Great Horned Tragoth's armor. Covers its wearer with a pair of giant horns, providing staunch poise.

name: Chain-draped Tabard
description: Padded cloth armor with a chainmail shawl draped over the shoulders. Widely issued to foot soldiers in a lord's army.

name: Cloth Garb
description: Clothing made of coarse material, commonly worn in the Lands Between.

name: Cleanrot Armor (altered)
description: Lighter version of the Cleanrot Armor

name: Commoner's Garb (altered)
description: Lighter version of the Commoner's Garb

name: Cleanrot Armor
description: Armor of the Cleanrot Knights, celebrated for their undefeated campaign in the Shattering. The Cleanrot Knights vowed to fight alongside Malenia, despite the inevitable, if gradual, putrefaction of their flesh. Their acceptance of their fate made these battles fiercest of all.

name: Commoner's Garb
description: Garb with a thick embroidered cape attached. Standard wear for commoners of the Lands Between.

name: Confessor Armor (altered)
description: Lighter version of the Confessor Armor

name: Confessor Armor
description: Black leather armor for blending in with the darkness. Worn by church confessors. The churches outside the Lands Between, dedicated to the teachings of the Two Fingers, send confessors out to follow the guidance of grace. The confessors are loyal servants to the Two Fingers, ready to hunt down and quietly dispose of their enemies.

name: Commoner's Simple Garb
description: Garb with a modest cloth cape attached. Standard wear for commoners of the Lands Between. The board hung from the neck depicts a sprawling tree, its roots and branches forming two holes. This is a self-imposed shackle, a voluntary display of allegiance to the Erdtree that increases faith.

name: Commoner's Simple Garb (altered)
description: Lighter version of the Commoner's Simple Garb

name: Consort's Robe
description: Fine robe of white silk worn by Tanith, Lady of the Volcano Manor.

name: Crucible Axe Armor
description: Armor of the Crucible Knights who served Godfrey, the first Elden Lord. Worn by the knight Ordovis and his men. Holds the power of the crucible of life, the primordial form of the Erdtree. Strengthens Aspects of the Crucible incantations.

name: Corhyn's Robe
description: Robe of Corhyn the cleric. Even after exile, Corhyn refused to recant his prophecies. And for this, he was blessed with the guidance of grace. Since then, the cart wheel draped on his neck has served as a reminder. That true guidance awaits those with iron wills. Those with unwavering faith.

name: Crucible Tree Armor
description: Armor of the Crucible Knights who served Godfrey, the first Elden Lord. Worn by the knight Siluria and her men. Holds the power of the crucible of life, the primordial form of the Erdtree. Strengthens Aspects of the Crucible incantations.

name: Crucible Axe Armor (altered)
description: Lighter version of the Crucible Axe Armor

name: Crucible Tree Armor (altered)
description: Lighter version of the Crucible Tree Armor

name: Cuckoo Surcoat
description: Armor worn by Raya Lucaria Academy soldiers. The surcoat depicts twinned cuckoos peering into a flourishing mass of glintstone. To a glintstone sorcerer, the body is a transient thing. The Cuckoo alone knows its insignificance, yet watches over it all the same.

name: Cuckoo Knight Armor
description: Armor worn by Raya Lucaria Academy knights.

name: Cuckoo Knight Armor (altered)
description: Lighter version of the Cuckoo Knight Armor

name: Deathbed Dress
description: Extremely thin and sheer white dress worn by the Deathbed Companion as she embraces the dead. Slowly replenishes the HP of nearby allies, but not that of the wearer. The touch of the fabric is exceedingly soft, so as not to harm even the most withered corpse, while still sharing her warmth.

name: Depraved Perfumer Robe
description: Robe worn by depraved perfumers. The embroidery on the apron is itself a curse upon the Erdtree. These heresy-inclined perfumers imbibe their own spices to alter body and mind. Their slow descent into self-destruction is  what earned them their name.

name: Drake Knight Armor
description: Black iron armor worn by drake knights. Features the spoils of a dragon catch as an emblem of pride as both dragon hunter and partake of communion. The cape is crafted with dragon wing membrane.

name: Drake Knight Armor (altered)
description: Lighter version of the Drake Knight Armor

name: Depraved Perfumer Robe (altered)
description: Lighter version of the Depraved Perfumer Robe

name: Elden Lord Armor (altered)
description: Lighter version of the Elden Lord Armor

name: Elden Lord Armor
description: Armor of Godfrey the first Elden Lord. The age of the Erdtree began amongst conflict, when Godfrey was lord of the battlefield. He led the War against the Giants. Faced the Storm Lord, alone. And then, there came a moment. When his last worthy enemy fell. And it was then, as the story is told, that the hue of Lord Godfrey's eyes faded.

name: Dirty Chainmail
description: Chainmail worn by young Albinaurics. The appearance of a protruding belly provides no benefits worthy of note.

name: Errant Sorcerer Robe
description: Commonplace robe made of thick cloth. Worn by the Errant Sorcerer Wilhelm, one of the first Tarnished to visit Roundtable Hold. A silent seeker of sorcery, who had gone so far as to make contact with the primeval current, Wilhelm was led by guidance into confrontation with his friend Vargram, and it is said that he was then taken prisoner in Roundtable Hold.

name: Erdtree Surcoat
description: Armor worn by soldiers sworn to defend the royal capital of Leyndell. The surcoat bears a majestic likeness of the Erdtree. Its golden backing is an honor bestowed on no other soldiers.

name: Eccentric's Armor
description: Unusually colorful armor. Worn by the knight Jerren. Jerren preferred a nomadic existence, but after spending time as guest of the Carian royals, he became a guest commander for General Radahn. And for the first time, the restless tumbleweed would be bound by honorable oath

name: Eye Surcoat
description: Brown surcoat draped over chainmail.

name: Festive Garb
description: Ceremonial garb worn by dancers at the festivities in Dominula, the village of windmills. Faintly bloodstained.

name: Errant Sorcerer Robe (altered)
description: Lighter version of the Errant Sorcerer Robe.

name: Festive Garb (altered)
description: Lighter version of the  Festive Garb.

name: Fia's Robe
description: Robe of black cloth that covers the entire body. Worn by Fia, the Deathbed Companion, on her journey after being exiled from her home.

name: Fell Omen Cloak
description: "A cloak of ragged fur worn about the exposed body of Margit, the Fell Omen.

name: Exile Armor
description: Damaged armor draped with a large deep-red cloth. Worn by soldiers sent to the penal colonies.

name: Finger Maiden Robe (altered)
description: Lighter version of the Finger Maiden Robe.

name: Finger Maiden Robe
description: Robe worn by maidens who serve the Two Fingers. The maidens live to serve a chosen Tarnished, sharing their guidance and the wisdom of the Two Fingers.

name: Fingerprint Armor
description: Iron armor singed and blistered by fingers. Worn by Vyke, knight of the Roundtable Hold. No other Tarnished was closer to the throne of the Elden Lord than Vyke. But without announcement, Vyke traveled far below the capital, and was scorched by the flame of frenzy. Did he make his choice for his maiden, or did some other force lure him with suggestion?

name: Fingerprint Armor (altered)
description: Lighter version of the Fingerprint Armor.

name: Fur Raiment
description: Raiment fashioned from a bristly pelt. Worn by ancestral follower warriors. The ancestral followers keep their distance from the Erdtree, awaiting new buds. They are certain to sprout from their very flesh, and indeed, their souls.

name: Gelmir Knight Armor
description: Armor worn by knights once royal to Praector Rykard.

name: Gelmir Knight Armor (altered)
description: Lighter version of the Gelmir Knight Armor.

name: Fire Prelate Armor
description: Black iron armor adorned with a red cloth. Attire of the Fire Prelates, commanders of the Fire Monks.

name: Godrick Knight Armor
description: Armor worn by knights loyal to Godrick The Grafted.

name: Godksin Noble Robe
description: Robe made by sewing together patches of smooth skin. Subcutaneous fat makes it plump and soft. Worn by Godskin Nobles known for their seven-face aprons. Strengthens the Noble Presence incantation. Nobles are the most ancient apostles who are said to have assimilated inhuman physiology. Not unlike the crucible, the Erdtree in its primordial form.

name: Fire Prelate Armor (altered)
description: Lighter version of the Fire Prelate Armor.

name: Foot Soldier Tabard
description: Padded cloth armor with more than a few stains. Widely issued to foot soldiers in a lord's army.

name: Fire Monk Armor
description: Black iron armor adorned with a red cloth. Attire of the Fire Monks.

name: Godrick Knight Armor (altered)
description: Lighter version of the Godric Knight Armor.

name: Goldmask's Rags
description: Worn rags that just barely cover the body. Lord Goldmask felt no draw to the vain excess of clothing; what use is finery to one who seeks greater brilliance?

name: Gravekeeper Cloak
description: Defensive wear encircled by bronze snakes. Worn by gladiators who were driven from the colosseum. The wearer becomes a slightly easier target for foes. The snake is viewed as a traitor to the Erdtree, and the audience delighted in seeing these bronze effigies beaten and battered.

name: Godskin Apostle Robe
description: Robe made by sewing together patches of smooth skin.

name: Haligtree Crest Surcoat
description: Armor worn by soldiers sworn to the Haligtree. The surcoat bears the crest of the Haligtree. Though watered with Miquella's own blood since it was a sapling, the Haligtree ultimately failed to grow into an Erdtree.

name: Gravekeeper Cloak (altered)
description: Lighter version of the Gravekeeper Cloak.

name: Guardian Garb
description: Engraved golden garb. Worn by guardians of the Minor Erdtree.

name: Haligtree Knight Armor
description: Armor worn by knights sworn the Haligtree.

name: Guardian Garb (full Bloom)
description: Engraved golden garb. Worn by the guardians of the Minor Erdtrees. Raises the HP recovery effects of the Flask of Crimson Tears, but greatly lowers fire damage negation. It is said that the blood-red flowers blooming on their backs mark the senescence of their ancient pact. Perhaps the guardians are part tree already

name: Haligtree Knight Armor (altered)
description: Lighter version of the Haligtree Knight Armor.

name: High Page Clothes
description: Clothes of a page selected for special privileges by the noble they serve.

name: Highwayman Cloth Armor
description: Hideously stained and ragged cloth armor. Worn by former foot soldiers who have turned to banditry.

name: High Page Clothes (altered)
description: Lighter version of the High Page Clothes.

name: Hoslow's Armor
description: Garish silver armor decorated with red embellishments. Passed down through the Hoslow family. When Juno Hoslow received an invitation to the Volcano Manor, he discreetly refused. "I have already walked many a road drenched in blood, yet never would I consider myself a champion."

name: Ivory-draped Tabard
description: Padded cloth armor with a shawl in the color of ivory draped over the shoulders. Worn by foot soldiers sworn to the Haligtree.

name: Knight Armor
description: Iron armor of an unknown knight. It is made of thin iron plate. Such metal armor is heavy, but provides considerable damage negation.

name: Juvenile Scholar Robe
description: Robe worn by young academy scholars, the juveniles birthed anew by the amber egg of Queen Rennala, the head of Raya Lucaria Academy. Yet their rebirth is not without imperfections, and thus do they repeat the process, eventually becoming utterly dependent upon it. Rebirth is as sleep to them, and with each awakening, memory fades into oblivion.

name: Kaiden Armor
description: Armor worn by Kaiden sellswords.

name: Land Of Reeds Armor
description: Armor made from strips of iron fastened together. Worn by warriors of the Land of Reeds. The Land of Reeds has long been locked in a miserable civil war, during which time it has remained alienated from the cultures of its neighbors. Little wonder that the entire nation has succumbed to blood-soaked madness, or so it is said.

name: Hoslow's Armor (altered)
description: Lighter version of the Hoslow's Armor.

name: Lazuli Robe
description: Robe worn by scholars of the Lazuli Conspectus, singular among the greater Raya Lucaria Academy. These scholars, who sought to master Carian sorcery, instead learned to see the moon as equal to the stars. This robe, in the hue of the full moon, signifies their heresy.

name: Leather Armor
description: Lightweight and battle-proven leather armor worn by a savvy soldier.

name: Leather-draped Tabard
description: Padded cloth armor with a leather shawl draped over the shoulders.

name: Lionel's Armor (altered)
description: Lighter version of the Lionel's Armor.

name: Leyndell Knight Armor (altered)
description: Lighter version of the Leyndell Knight Armor.

name: Leyndell Knight Armor
description: Armor worn by knights sworn to defend the royal capital of Leyndell. Its left breast is emblazoned with a symbol of Erdtree Worship, said to have once been imbued with an incantation of protection.

name: Lionel's Armor
description: Round iron armor with a banner extending from its back. Worn by the Lionel the Lionhearted.

name: Lord Of Blood's Robe
description: Attire of Mohg, Lord of Blood, embroidered with an extravagant gold emblem on black cloth. The dress of a Luminary, the reigning lord and hierarch of the coming dynasty of Mohgwyn. Or perhaps, of a raving lunatic.

name: Lusat's Robe
description: A robe reserved for grand masters at the Academy of Raya Lucaria. Corroded by blue glintstones.

name: Lord Of Blood's Robe (altered)
description: Lighter version of the Lord Of Blood's Robe.

name: Malenia's Armor
description: Armor made of unalloyed gold. Worn by Malenia, Blade of Miquella. Malenia awaited Miquella at the foot of the husk. "My brother will keep his promise. He possesses the wisdom, the allure, of a god - he is the most fearsome Empyrean of all."

name: Maliketh's Armor (altered)
description: Lighter version of the Maliketh's Armor.

name: Malenia's Armor (altered)
description: Lighter version of the Maleinia's Armor.

name: Malformed Dragon Armor
description: Malformed golden armor. Adorned with various dragon imagery and worn by the misshapen Tree Sentinels. After the great ancient dragon Gransax attacked, the sentinels had an epiphany. The only way to truly protect the Erdtree was to become dragons themselves.

name: Maliketh's Armor
description: Beast's armor made of black iron and decorated with gold. Worn by Maliketh the Black Blade. Maliketh, Queen Marika's loyal half-brother, bore a blade imbued with Destined Death, and there was not one demigod who did not fear him. Champions knew what was at stake. Indeed, that is what made them champions.

name: Marionette Soldier Armor
description: Armor of metal bands arranged in a lattice. Worn by marionette soldiers, crafted to serve the sorcerers. The construction of this armor is remarkably crude, now rusted over and severely dented. For a doll, the only thing that matters is that it does not break.

name: Marais Robe
description: Robe with a black mantle across the shoulders. Customarily worn by the head of House Marais. The sons of House Marais are all sickly born. Little wonder that Maleigh Marais would be so beguiled by the beautiful and fierce goddess who was born into rot.

name: Mausoleum Knight Armor
description: Armor worn by headless knights who endlessly guard the Wandering Mausoleum. The wing-shaped ornaments on its back evoke the Deathbird. A self-inflicted curse that ties the spirits of these loyal knights to the land, having willingly beheaded themselves so that they may serve theirs masters in death.

name: Mausoleum Surcoat
description: Armor worn by headless soldiers who endlessly guard the Wandering Mausoleum.

name: Mausoleum Knight Armor (altered)
description: Lighter version of the Mausoleum Knight Armor

name: Mushroom Body
description: Mushrooms found growing all over the body. These overgrown mushroom have colonized the torso. To those enraptured by the scarlet rot, they are holy vestments that root one to the earth.

name: Nomadic Merchant's Finery (altered)
description: Lighter version of the Nomadic Merchant's Finery

name: Night's Cavalry Armor (altered)
description: Lighter version of the Night's Cavalry Armor

name: Night's Cavalry Armor
description: Pitch-black armor thinly painted with dried blood. Worn by the Night's Cavalry who ride funeral steeds.

name: Night Maiden Armor
description: Armor worn by the nightmaidens of the Eternal City. Indicates the highest clerical rank, and includes a silk cape. Long ago, the Nox invoked the ire of the Greater Will, and were banished deep underground. Now they live under a false night sky, in eternal anticipation of their liege. Of the coming age of the stars. And their Lord of Night.

name: Nomadic Merchant's Finery
description: Finery of the nomadic merchants.

name: Noble's Traveling Garb
description: Traveling attire fashioned from metallic white silk thread. Worn by expatriated royalty. A gift of such rare beauty, a royal wouldn't disgrace their illustrious heritage even if found dead, in a ditch, in the middle of nowhere, while wearing such splendid raiment.

name: Nox Monk Armor
description: Armor worn by the monks of the Eternal City, with a silk cape attached. Long ago, the Nox invoked the ire of the Greater Will, and were banished deep underground. Now they live under a false night sky, in eternal anticipation of their liege. Of the coming age of the stars. And their Lord of Night.

name: Nox Swordstress Armor (altered)
description: Lighter version of the Nox Swordstress Armor.

name: Nox Monk Armor (altered)
description: Lighter version of the Nox Monk Armor.

name: Nox Swordstress Armor
description: Armor worn by swordstresses of the Eternal City. These women are the personal guards of the nightmaidens, and wear silk capes. Long ago, the Nox invoked the ire of the Greater Will, and were banished deep underground. Now they live under a false night sky, in eternal anticipation of their liege. Of the coming age of the stars. And their Lord of Night.

name: Omen Armor
description: Malformed armor resembling an Omen with its horns cut off.

name: Official's Attire
description: Grubby blue robe worn by magisterial officials to carry out their grim tasks. Surveillance, executions, gruesome rituals... The darkest duties drive the wheels of mankind.

name: Page Garb
description: Garb worn by pages who serve the nobility and are mindful to keep them out of harm's way.

name: Perfumer's Traveling Garb
description: Garb of a traveling perfumer of no renown.

name: Page Garb (altered)
description: Lighter version of the Page Garb.

name: Perfumer Robe
description: Robe of an Erdtree Capital perfumer.

name: Perfumer's Traveling Garb (altered)
description: Lighter version of the Perfumer's Traveling Garb.

name: Perfumer Robe (altered)
description: Lighter version of the Perfurmer's Robe.

name: Omenkiller Robe
description: Robe worn by the Omenkillers, butchers of twisted conscience.

name: Old Aristocrat Gown
description: Gown of soft cloth adorned with fine gold embroidery. Travel attire worn by nobles in the capital. Garb favored by the aged. Abandoning their birthplace after the Shattering, these undead wanderers are the pitiful product of unending life.

name: Preceptor's Long Gown (altered)
description: Lighter version of the Preceptor's Long Gown.

name: Preceptor's Long Gown
description: A long, bright blue gown with the movements of the stars drawn upon it. Worn by the magic preceptors who served the Carian royals. Glintstone sorcerers are the descendants of astrologers, a fact that the Carians remain aware of. Even if their fate has been long severed from the stars.

name: Prophet Robe (altered)
description: Lighter version of the Prophet Robe.

name: Queen's Robe
description: Robe indicating the highest order of sorcerer. Worn by Rennala, Queen of the Full Moon. When Rennala, head of both the Academy of Raya Lucaria and the Carian royal family, lost her husband Radagon, her heart went along with him. And then, those at the academy realized. That Rennala was no champion, after all.

name: Prophet Robe
description: Robe of exiled prophets who foresaw that their faith would end in flames — and were persecuted and driven from their homes as a result. Its fabric scrapes against their skin like a file, and the rickety cart wheel around the neck warns passers-by not to lend an ear to their meandering sermons.

name: Prisoner Clothing
description: Tattered clothing. Worn by a prisoner convicted of an appalling crime. Never once washed, every fiber is filthy.

name: Ragged Armor
description: Armor pieced together from scavenged metal.

name: Ragged Armor (altered)
description: Lighter version of the Ragged Armor.

name: Radahn's Lion Armor (altered)
description: Lighter version of the Radahn's Lion Armor.

name: Radahn's Lion Armor
description: Armor depicting the golden lion. Worn by General Radahn.

name: Raging Wolf Armor (altered)
description: Armor worn by Vargram the Raging Wolf, one of the first Tarnished to visit the Roundtable Hold.

name: Raya Lucarian Robe
description: Robe worn by Raya Lucaria's magic scholars. Those who dedicate themselves to the study of glintstones formed from starry amber receive this modest yet elegant deep blue garb along with their vows of virtue and austerity. But with extended life, one is apt to forget old vows.

name: Raging Wolf Armor
description: Armor worn by Vargram the Raging Wolf, one of the first Tarnished to visit the Roundtable Hold. According to the old legends, wolves are the shadows of the Empyrean. Vargram aspired to such a state himself.

name: Redmane Surcoat
description: Armor worn by soldiers who fought by General Radahn's side.

name: Ronin's Armor
description: Armor of the man who calls himself Shabriri. Highly functional and heavily worn.

name: Rotten Gravekeeper Cloak
description: Thick, bristly cloak eaten through by scarlet rot. The symbol of an underground gravekeeper's station.

name: Redmane Knight Armor (altered)
description: Lighter version of the Redmane Knight Armor. The armor is not as sturdy as the original, but it still provides a decent amount of protection.

name: Ronin's Armor (altered)
description: Lighter version of the Ronin's Armor. The armor is not as sturdy as the original, but it still provides a decent amount of protection.

name: Redmane Knight Armor
description: Armor worn by knights who fought by General Radahn's side.

name: Raptor's Black Feathers
description: Robe crafted with the black feathers of a bird of prey. Worn by the assassin Ravenmount.

name: Royal Knight Armor
description: Silver armor of Loretta, a knight who served Miquella's Haligtree. Loretta, once a royal Carian knight, went on a journey in search of a haven for Albinaurics, and determined that the Haligtree was their best chance for eventual salvation.

name: Royal Knight Armor (altered)
description: Lighter version of the Royal Knight Armor. The armor is not as sturdy as the original, but it still provides a decent amount of protection.

name: Rotten Gravekeeper Cloak (altered)
description: Lighter version of the Rotten Gravekeeper Cloak.

name: Royal Remains Armor
description: Armory graces with gold human bones. Worn by the unspeaking adherent of Sir Gideon the All-Knowing.

name: Scaled Armor
description: Armor worn by Old Knight Istvan. The corroded metal is reinforced with rock-hard scales, making it high effective against non-physical attacks.

name: Sanguine Noble Robe
description: Robe of dyed black cloth featuring gold embroidery. Worn by the nobles who serve the Lord of Blood. The grand metallic pattern on the shoulder is a signifier of the noble rank they intend to claim upon the advent of the new dynasty they are working to install.

name: Ruler's Robe
description: Luxurious robe worn by lords in a smaller nation. Its fine blue mantle serves to prove its wearer's status.

name: Scaled Armor (altered)
description: Lighter version of the Scaled Armor

name: Sage Robe
description: Thick burgundy robe. Attire of the wise sages who were deemed heretical. Evidence that the wearer was driven from town.

name: Scale Armor
description: Armor reinforced with small metal scales. The cape covering the shoulders is made with treated rock lizard skin, and provides ample protection against fire.

name: Traveling Maiden Robe (altered)
description: Lighter version of the Traveling Maiden Robe

name: Snow Witch Robe (altered)
description: Lighter version of the Snow Witch Robe

name: Scarlet Tabard
description: Padded cloth armor with the telltale stains of the scarlet rot. Worn by foot soldiers in General Radahn's army

name: Shaman Furs
description: Raiment fashioned from a bristly pelt. Worn by ancestral follower shamans.

name: Traveling Maiden Robe
description: Robe worn by traveling maidens. Maidens traversed the Lands Between for different reasons. Some to seek audience with the Fingers. Others, to find the Tarnished who they were destined to guide.

name: Snow Witch Robe
description: Witch's robe in the color of snow. Once worn by the snowy crone who the young Ranni encountered deep in the woods. She was a witch, and well versed in cold sorceries. It is said that the doll that houses Ranni's soul was modeled after her. That old witch was Ranni's secret mentor.

name: Tree Sentinel Armor
description: Golden armor of the heavy cavalry Tree Sentinels who serve the Erdtree.

name: Spellblade's Traveling Attire (altered)
description: Lighter version of the Spellblade's Traveling Attire

name: Traveler's Clothes
description: Light yet sturdy clothes.

name: Spellblade's Traveling Attire
description: Glintstone sorcerer Rogier's traveling attire, graced with an intricate, aristocratic decoration. Strengthens glintstone sorcery skills.

name: Tree Sentinel Armor (altered)
description: Lighter version of the Tree Sentinel Armor

name: Twinned Armor (altered)
description: Lighter version of the Twinned Armor

name: Vagabond Knight Armor (altered)
description: Lighter version of the Vagabond Knight Armor

name: Vagabond Knight Armor
description: Chest piece of a knight banished from their motherland.  Dirty and battered after enduring a lengthy vagabond journey.

name: Veteran's Armor
description: Old armor that has seen many battles. Worn by Niall, the veteran general of Sol. Niall was a lone survivor who commanded spirits to defend his long-passed master. This aging general could not die, nor did he have anywhere to fade away.

name: Twinned Armor
description: Armor depicting entwined twins of gold and silver.

name: Veteran's Armor (altered)
description: Lighter version of the Veteran's Armor

name: Tree Surcoat
description: Blue surcoat draped over chainmail. The tree insignia emblazoned on the front depicts the Erdtree, and is a design beloved throughout the Lands Between.

name: Upper-class Robe
description: Embroidered, bright green robe worn by noble children. Donning such a robe is traditionally the child's first show of burgeoning independence.

name: Tree-and-beast Surcoat
description: Armor worn by soldiers loyal to Godrick the Grafted. The surcoat depicts the distant Erdtree and the beast regent, an emblem of the golden lineage. Both are symbols of glory now past.

name: Vulgar Militia Armor
description: Armor worn by lean, mean, and filthy militiamen.

name: White Reed Armor
description: Armor of the White Reeds, fashioned from banded iron plates. Worn by the Inabam head disciples of the great swordsman Okina.

name: War Surgeon Gown
description: "Bloodstained white gown of the war surgeons who were effectively mercy killers. Of the surgeons that were abducted by the Lord of Blood none were able to tame the accursed blood. None but Varré, that is; though he was an exception."

name: War Surgeon Gown (altered)
description: Lighter version of the War Surgeon Gown.

name: Azur's Manchettes
description: Manchettes corroded by blue-green glintstones. Worn by Azur, primeval current sorcerer.

name: Battlemage Manchettes
description: Manchettes worn by scholars of the Raya Lucaria Academy, tattered from being worn on the battlefield.

name: Astrologer Gloves
description: Gloves fashioned from fine, supple cloth. Worn by those who look to the cosmos above. They read fate in the stars, and are said to be heirs of the glintstone sorcerers. But alas, the night sky no longer cradles fate.

name: Bandit Manchettes
description: Manchettes made by simple wrapping dirty cloth around the arms. Worn by bandits.

name: Banished Knight Gauntlets
description: Thick, full set of armor covering the entire body. These gauntlets were worn by knights who, whether by misfortune or misdeed, were forced to abandon their homes. These fierce warriors were each and all accomplished. Perhaps that is why, despite their territorial losses, they were still named knights.

name: Zamor Armor
description: Armor worn by knights of Zamor, hailed as heroes in the War against the Giants. These long-lived warriors, clad in biting, freezing winds, are said to have been the mortal enemies of the Fire Giants since time immemorial.

name: Alberich's Bracers
description: Mad Tongue Alberich's bracers.

name: Beast Champion Gauntlets
description: Silver gauntlets engraved with tiny beasts. Worn by Bernahl the Recusant. Beasts are drawn to champions, and to lords. And this armor befits a champion worthy of becoming a lord. And that is what Bernahl was. Until his maiden threw herself into the fire.

name: Black Knife Gauntlets
description: Gauntlets used by the Black Knife Assassins. Crafted with scale armor that makes no sound. The assassins that carried out the deeds of the Night of the Black Knives were all women, and rumored to be Numen who had close ties with Marika herself.

name: Blackflame Monk Gauntlets
description: Black iron gauntlets featuring a flame motif. Attire of the Blackflame Monks.

name: Blaidd's Gauntlets
description: Well-worn black gauntlets of the man-wolf Blaidd.

name: Brave's Bracer
description: Gauntlets wrapped in thick leather. Garb worn by warriors of the frigid uplands. Has a fur lining which excels at keeping the cold at bay.

name: Briar Gauntlets
description: Battered iron gauntlets from a foreign land. Worn by Elemer of the Briar.

name: Bull-goat Gauntlets
description: Great Horned Tragoth's gauntlets. Covers its wearer with a pair of giant horns, providing staunch poise.

name: Bloodsoaked Manchettes
description: Manchettes formed from tightly-wound bandages soaked through with blood. Any protection is welcome for the festering arms beneath.

name: Bloodhound Knight Gauntlets
description: Metal gauntlets of the Bloodhound Knights.

name: Blue Silver Bracelets
description: Bracelets crafted with blue silver. Worn by the wolf-riding Albinauric archers.

name: Carian Knight Gauntlets
description: Gauntlets of the enchanted knights that once served the Carian royal family. The enchanted knights, anointed by the Lunar Queen,  were heroes of the highest honors, but fell into disarray with the decline of the royal family.

name: Chain Gauntlets
description: Gauntlets made of woven chain. Standard issue for ordinary soldiers. Though plain in appearance, they offer dependable protection.

name: Cuckoo Knight Gauntlets
description: Gauntlets worn by Raya Lucaria Academy knights. Time has yet to dull their luster.

name: Confessor Gloves
description: Black leather gloves of the church confessors. The churches outside the Lands Between, dedicated to the teachings of the Two Fingers, send confessors out to follow the guidance of grace. The confessors are loyal servants to the Two Fingers, ready to hunt down and quietly dispose of their enemies.

name: Cleanrot Gauntlets
description: Gauntlets of the Cleanrot Knights, celebrated for their undefeated campaign in the Shattering. The Cleanrot Knights vowed to fight alongside Malenia, despite the inevitable, if gradual, putrefaction of their flesh. Their acceptance of their fate made these battles fiercest of all.

name: Champion Bracers
description: Bracers reserved for the bandlands' bravest.  Proof that the wearer has slaughtered countless foes.  Following the example of their chieftain Hoarah Loux, the brave warriors of the badlands shun excess adornment.

name: Depraved Perfumer Gloves
description: Gloves worn by depraved perfumers.

name: Champion Gauntlets
description: Gauntlets reserved for the badlands' bravest. Proof that the wearer has slaughtered countless foes. Following the example of their chieftain Hoarah Loux, the brave warriors of the badlands shun excess adornment.

name: Elden Lord Bracers
description: Bracers of Godfrey the first Elden Lord. The age of the Erdtree began amongst conflict, when Godfrey was lord of the battlefield. He led the War against the Giants. Faced the Storm Lord, alone. And then, there came a moment. When his last worthy enemy fell. And it was then, as the story is told, that the hue of Lord Godfrey's eyes faded.

name: Eccentric's Manchettes
description: The knight Jerren's manchettes. Jerren preferred a nomadic existence, but after spending time as a guest of the Carian royals, he became the guest commander for General Radahn. And for the first time, the restless tumbleweed would be bound by honorable oath.

name: Drake Knight Gauntlets
description: Black iron gauntlets worn by drake knights. Features the spoils of a dragon catch as an emblem of pride as both dragon hunter and partaker of communion. From birth, drake knights speak not a word. They spend their lives pursuing the strength of dragons, for its sublime beauty and inspiration of awe

name: Crucible Gauntlets
description: Gauntlets of the Crucible Knights who served Godfrey, the first Elden Lord. Hold the power of the crucible of life, the primordial form of the Erdtree. Strengthen Aspects of the Crucible incantations. In time, the strength shown by these knights, and even their appearance, was seen as chaotic and deserving of scorn.

name: Errant Sorcerer Manchettes
description: Commonplace leather manchettes. Their hands are inlaid with dulled glintstone.

name: Fire Monk Gauntlets
description: Black iron gauntlets featuring a flame motif. Attire of the Fire Monks.

name: Godrick Knight Gauntlets
description: Gauntlets worn by knights loyal to Godrick the Grafted. Time has yet to dull their luster.

name: Gelmir Knight Gauntlets
description: Gauntlets worn by knights once loyal to Praetor Rykard. Time has yet to dull their luster.

name: Foot Soldier Gauntlets
description: Metal gauntlets covered in nicks and dents. Widely issued to foot soldiers in a lord's army.

name: Exile Gauntlets
description: Damaged iron gauntlets. Worn by soldiers sent to the penal colonies.

name: Fingerprint Gauntlets
description: Iron gauntlets singed and blistered by fingers. Worn by Vyke, knight of the Roundtable Hold. No other Tarnished was closer to the throne of the Elden Lord than Vyke. But without announcement, Vyke traveled far below the capital, and was scorched by the flame of frenzy. Did he make his choice for his maiden, or did some other force lure him with suggestion?

name: Godrick Soldier Gauntlets
description: Gauntlets worn by soldiers loyal to Godrick the Grafted. Rust-worn and stained through unending conflict.

name: Fire Prelate Gauntlets
description: Black iron gauntlets with the appearance of flames. Attire of the Fire Prelates, commanders of the Fire Monks.

name: Godskin Apostle Bracelets
description: Black bracelets of the Godskin Apostles.

name: Highwayman Gauntlets
description: Hideously stained and dented gauntlets. Worn by former foot soldiers who have turned to banditry.

name: Godskin Noble Bracelets
description: Black bracelets of the Godskin Nobles. Nobles are the most ancient apostles who are said to have assimilated inhuman physiology. Not unlike the crucible, the Erdtree in its primordial form.

name: Haligtree Gauntlets
description: Gauntlets worn by soldiers sworn to the Haligtree. Rust-worn and stained through unending conflict.

name: Haligtree Knight Gauntlets
description: Gauntlets worn by knights sworn to the Haligtree. Time has yet to dull their luster.

name: Hoslow's Gauntlets
description: Garish silver gauntlets decorated with red embellishments. Passed down through the Hoslow family.

name: Kaiden Gauntlets
description: Gauntlets worn by Kaiden sellswords.

name: Iron Gauntlets
description: Ordinary iron gauntlets.

name: Gold Bracelets
description: Bracelets made in the image of Erdtree branches. Minimal adornments made my Lord Goldmask's disciples. Those disciples have long since left him.

name: Guardian Bracers
description: Engraved golden bracers. Worn by the guardians of the Minor Erdtree.

name: Golden Prosthetic
description: Golden prosthetic forged using ancient techniques

name: Knight Gauntlets
description: Iron gauntlets of an unknown knight. It is made of thin iron plate. Such metal armor is heavy, but provides considerable damage negation.

name: Land Of Reeds Gauntlets
description: Gauntlets wrapped in tough leather. Worn by the warriors of the Land of Reeds

name: Lusat's Manchettes
description: Manchettes corroded by blue glintstones. Worn by Lusat, primeval current sorcerer.

name: Maliketh's Gauntlets
description: Beast's gauntlets made of black iron and decorated with gold. Worn by Maliketh the Black Blade. Maliketh, Queen Marika's loyral half-brother, bore a blade imbued with Destined Death, and there was not one demigod who did not fear him. Champions knew what was at stake. Indeed, that is what made them champions

name: Leyndell Soldier Gauntlets
description: Gauntlets worn by soldiers sworn to defend the royal capital of Leyndell. Rust-worn and stained through unending conflict.

name: Leather Gloves
description: Lightweight and battle-proven leather gloves worn by a savvy soldier. Many admire the wearer of this armor for his chivalrous and forthright spirit.

name: Lionel's Gauntlets
description: Founded iron gauntlets.

name: Malenia's Gauntlet
description: Gauntlet made of unalloyed gold. Worn by Malenia, Blade of Miquella. Malenia awaited Miquella at the foot of the husk. "My brother will keep his promise. He possesses the wisdom, the allure, of a god—he is the most fearsome Empyrean of all."

name: Malformed Dragon Gauntlets
description: Malformed golden gauntlets.

name: Leyndell Knight Gauntlets
description: Gauntlets worn by knights sworn to defend the royal capital of Leyndell. Time has yet to dull their luster

name: Omen Gauntlets
description: Malformed Gauntlets resembling an Omen with its horns cut off.

name: Mushroom Arms
description: Mushrooms found growing all over the body. These overgrown mushroom have colonized the arms.

name: Mausoleum Knight Gauntlets
description: Gauntlets worn by headless knights who endlessly guard the Walking Mausoleum. Time has yet to dull their luster.

name: Mausoleum Gauntlets
description: Gauntlets worn by headless soldiers who endlessly guard the Wandering Mausoleum. Rust-worn and stained through unending conflict.

name: Millicent's Gloves
description: Gloves worn by Millicent the Rotting

name: Nox Monk Bracelets
description: Bracelets worn by the monks of the Eternal City. Long ago, the Nox invoked the ire of the Greater Will, and were banished deep underground. Now they live under a false night sky, in eternal anticipation of their liege. Of the coming age of the stars. And their Lord of Night.

name: Noble's Gloves
description: Gloves of plush leather. Worn by expatriated royalty. A gift of such rare beauty, a royal wouldn't disgrace their illustrious heritage even if found dead, in a ditch, in the middle of nowhere, while wearing such splendid raiment.

name: Perfumer Gloves
description: Gloves of an Erdtree Capital perfumer.

name: Night's Cavalry Gauntlets
description: Pitch-black gauntlets thinly painted with dried blood. Worn by the Night's Cavalry who ride funeral steeds.

name: Omenkiller Long Gloves
description: Long,stiff leather gloves worn by the Omenkillers.

name: Preceptor's Gloves
description: Trousers of the magic preceptors who serve the Carian royals. Black and perfectly discreet.

name: Raya Lucarian Gauntlets
description: Gauntlets worn by Raya Lucaria Academy soldiers. Rust-worn and stained through unending conflict.

name: Ragged Gloves
description: Gauntlets pieced together from scavenged metal.

name: Radahn Soldier Gauntlets
description: Gauntlets worn by soldiers who fought by General Radahn's side. Rust-worn and stained through unending conflict.

name: Radahn's Gauntlets
description: Gauntlets depicting the golden lion. Worn by General Radahn.

name: Royal Knight Gauntlets
description: Silver gauntlets of Loretta, a knight who served Miquella's Haligtree. Loretta, once a royal Carian knight, went on a journey in search of a haven for Albinaurics, and determined that the Haligtree was their best chance for eventual salvation.

name: Ronin's Gauntlets
description: Gauntlets of the man who calls himself Shabriri. Highly functional and heavily worn.

name: Queen's Bracelets
description: Bracelets indicating the highest order of sorcerer. Worn by Rennala, Queen of the Full Moon. When Rennala, head of both the Academy of Raya Lucaria and the Carian royal family, lost her husband Radagon, her heart went along with him. And then, those at the academy realized. That Rennala was no champion, after all.

name: Royal Remains Gauntlets
description: Gauntlets graces with gold human bones. Worn by the unspeaking adherent of Sir Gideon the All-Knowing.

name: Traveler's Gloves
description: Gloves of a traveling perfumer of no renown.

name: Tree Sentinel Gauntlets
description: Golden gauntlets of the heavy cavalry Tree Sentinels who serve the Erdtree.

name: Traveler's Manchettes
description: Light yet sturdy leather manchettes.

name: Sorcerer Manchettes
description: Manchettes worn by Raya Lucaria's magic scholars. Made by wrapping a simple cloth around the forearms.

name: Twinned Gauntlets
description: Gauntlets depicting entwined twins of gold and silver.

name: Traveling Maiden Gloves
description: Gloves worn by traveling maidens.

name: Vagabond Knight Gauntlets
description: Gauntlets of a knight banished form their motherland. Dirty and battered after enduring a lengthy vagabond journey. Metal armor is heavy, but also sturdy, offering significant damage negation.

name: Veteran's Gauntlets
description: Old gauntlets that has seen many battles. Worn by Niall, the veteran general of Sol.

name: Scaled Gauntlets
description: Gauntlets worn by Old Knight Istvan. The corroded metal is reinforced with rock-hard scales, making it high effective against non-physical attacks. Istvan is one of a few wizened Tarnished who survived to this day.

name: Spellblade's Gloves
description: Glintstone sorcerer Rogier's traveling attire, graced with an intricate, aristocratic decoration. Strengthens glintstone sorcery skills.

name: Vulgar Militia Gauntlets
description: Gauntlets worn by lean, mean, and filthy militiamen.

name: Aristocrat Hat
description: Leather hat decorated with a withered feather. Travel attire worn by nobles in the capital, and the belonging of a family which claims a knight as an ancestor.

name: Warrior Gauntlets
description: Gauntlets of a nomadic warrior. Crafted from sturdy leather.

name: Aristocrat Headband
description: Valuable headband featuring fine goldwork.

name: Alberich's Pointed Hat (altered)
description: Lighter version of the Alberich's Pointed Hat.

name: Alberich's Pointed Hat
description: Mad Tongue Alberich's pointed hat, a sign of a heretical practitioner.

name: War Surgeon Gloves
description: Bloodstained white gloves of the war surgeons who were effectively mercy killers. Of the surgeons that were abducted by the Lord of Blood none were able to tame the accursed blood. None but Varré, that is; though he was an exception

name: Zamor Bracelets
description: Bracelets worn by knights of Zamor, hailed as heroes in the War against the Giants. These long-lived warriors, clad in biting, freezing winds, are said to have been the mortal enemies of the Fire Giants since time immemorial.

name: White Reed Gauntlets
description: Gauntlets of the White Reeds, fashioned from banded iron plates. Worn by the Inabam head disciples of the great swordsman Okina. The Inaba traveled in pursuit of not only the master who abandoned them, but also proper deaths, won honorably through hard-fought combat. To be a White Reed is to seek death; fitting for the Inaba, who desired nothingmore than to die by the sword.

name: Bandit Mask
description: Mask of black cloth that covers the mouth. Favored by bandits for hiding their faces, it also provides some protection against poison.

name: Black Dumpling
description: Mask forced on a victim's head to lend torture an extra degree of cruelty. It magnifies one's fears and make them acutely aware of all forms of pain Raises attack power when the wearer suffers from madness. When the Black Dumpling goes on, the torturer no longer seeks answers; only to inflict suffering without hope of relief.

name: Banished Knight Helm (altered)
description: Lighter version of the Banished Knight Helm

name: Ash-of-war Scarab
description: Gray scarab worn directly on the head.

name: Astrologer Hood
description: Hood fashioned from supple cloth. Worn by those who look to the cosmos above. They read fate in the stars, and are said to be heirs of the glintstone sorcerers. But alas, the night sky no longer cradles fate.

name: Black Hood
description: Hood of lusterless black fabric that conceals its wearer's identity.

name: Azur's Glintstone Crown
description: Crown of Azur, primeval current sorcerer, set with a prominent blue-green glintstone.

name: Banished Knight Helm
description: Thick, full set of armor covering the entire body. This helm was worn by knights who, whether by misfortune or misdeed, were forced to abandon their homes. These fierce warriors were each and all accomplished. Perhaps that is why, despite their territorial losses, they were still named knights.

name: Beast Champion Helm
description: Silver helm engraved with tiny beasts. Worn by Bernahl the Recusant.

name: Black Wolf Mask
description: A mask fashioned after the head of a black wolf.

name: Bloodsoaked Mask
description: Mask formed from tightly-wound bandages soaked through with blood. Even the most ghastly cover is more inviting than the festering face beneath.

name: Black Knife Hood
description: Hood used by the Black Knife Assassins. The assassins that carried out the deeds of the Night of the Black Knives were all women, and rumored to be N u men who had close ties with Marika herself.

name: Blue Silver Mail Hood
description: Chainmail hood crafted with blue silver. Worn by the wolf-riding Albinauric archers.

name: Bloodhound Knight Helm
description: Metal helm with a pointed beak. Worn by the Bloodhound Knights. The Bloodhound Knights are trained as hunters and known to be unshakable trackers. Without the use of language, each knight chooses his own master. Once the decision has been made, the knight stays loyal for life.

name: Blackguard's Iron Mask
description: Iron mask forced on convicted prisoners. Worn by the blackguard Big Boggart. To Boggart, the mask made him all the more threatening, and helped him get what he wanted. But it was also a mirror of his emptiness.

name: Blue Festive Hood
description: Hood worn by dancers at the festivities in Dominula, the village of windmills. Use of this hood, dyed in a stunning blue, is only permitted for the young maids who play the central role in the festival.

name: Blackflame Monk Hood
description: Mail hood of iron links covering a headband engraved with black flames.

name: Blue Cloth Cowl
description: Cowl of a nomadic warrior. The blue color of its fabric symbolizes brisk waters, as fluid and flowing as the sword in the hand of its wearer. Just as still waters turn foul, stagnation leads to decay. Warriors must remain ever-drifting.

name: Champion Headband
description: Headband reserved for the badlands' bravest. Proof that the wearer has slaughtered countless foes. Following the example of their chieftain Hoarah Loux, the brave warriors of the badlands shun excess adornment.

name: Chain Coif
description: Coif made of woven chain. Standard issue for ordinary soldiers. Though plain in appearance, it offers dependable protection.

name: Bull-goat Helm
description: Great Horned Tragoth's helm, adorned with a gold bull-goat motif. Provides high poise.

name: Brave's Cord Circlet
description: Warrior's headband of woven leather. Garb worn by warriors of the frigid uplands. The small flags, white cloths and sheaves of wheat often found hung from these headbands are prayers of farewell from the people of their home. In bidding farewell t warriors departing on a journey from which they aren't like to return, this small act offers only meager relief.

name: Cerulean Tear Scarab
description: Blue scarab worn directly on the head. These scarabs roll clumps of cerulean tears during their labors.

name: Cleanrot Helm
description: Winged helm of the Cleanrot Knights, celebrated for their undefeated campaign in the Shattering.

name: Carian Knight Helm
description: Helm of the enchanted knights that once served the Carian royal family. The enchanted knights, anointed by the Lunar Queen, were heroes of the highest honors, but fell into disarray with the decline of the royal family.

name: Briar Helm
description: Battered iron helm from a foreign land. Worn by Elemer of he Brair.

name: Brave's Leather Helm
description: Battlewear wrapped in thick leather. Garb worn by warriors of the frigid uplands.

name: Cleanrot Helm (altered)
description: Lighter version of the Cleanrot Helm

name: Confessor Hood
description: Black hood for blending in with the darkness. Worn by church confessors. The churches outside the Lands Between, dedicated to the teachings of the Two Fingers, send confessors out to follow the guidance of grace. The confessors are loyal servants to the Two Fingers, ready to hunt down and quietly dispose of their enemies.

name: Commoner's Headband (altered)
description: Lighter version of the Commoner's Headband

name: Confessor Hood (altered)
description: Lighter version of the Confessor Hood

name: Commoner's Headband
description: A headband with the cloth removed. Standard wear for commoners of the Lands Between.

name: Consort's Mask
description: Mask worn by Tanith, Lady of the Volcano Manor, in the image of a foreign queen.

name: Crucible Axe Helm
description: Helm of the Crucible Knights who served Godfrey, the first Elden Lord. The axe ornamentation is the knight Ordovis's mark, displayed also by his men. Holds the power of the crucible of life, the primordial form of the Erdtree. Strengthens Aspects of the Crucible incantations.

name: Crimson Hood
description: A hooded cloak of vivid crimson.  Worn by expatriates royalty.  Increases vigor.

name: Crimson Tear Scarab
description: Red scarab worn directly on the head. The red scarabs roll clumps of crimson tears during their labors.

name: Crucible Tree Helm
description: Helm of the Crucible Knights who served Godfrey, the first Elden Lord. The great tree ornamentation is the knight Siluria's mark, displayed also by her men. Holds the power of the crucible of life, the primordial form of the Erdtree. Strengthens Aspects of the Crucible incantations.

name: Diallos's Mask
description: Replica of a twin-tailed silver helm with flowery adornments. Only, without the twin tails.

name: Drake Knight Helm (altered)
description: Lighter version of the Drake Knight Helm.

name: Depraved Perfumer Headscarf
description: Headscarf worn by depraved perfumers.

name: Cuckoo Knight Helm
description: Helm worn by Raya Lucaria Academy knights. Its brow is adorned with a single cuckoo's feather.

name: Duelist Helm
description: Bronze helm decorated with innumerable snakes. Worn by gladiators who were driven from the colosseum. The wearer becomes a slightly easier target for foes. The snake is viewed as a traitor to the Erdtree, and the audience delighted in seeing these bronze effigies beaten and battered.

name: Eccentric's Hood
description: A pointy, ragged hood. Worn by the knight Jerren. The hood hides an aged, bearded mask. Jerren served General Radahn as a guest commander, and they are said to have sworn an oath of honorable death to one another.

name: Drake Knight Helm
description: Black iron helm worn by drake knights. Features the spoils of a dragon catch as an emblem of pride as both dragon hunter and partaker of communion. From birth, drake knights speak not a word. They spend their lives pursuing the strength of dragons, for its sublime beauty and inspiration of awe

name: Eccentric's Hood (altered)
description: Lighter version of the Eccentric's Hood

name: Elden Lord Crown
description: Crown of Godfrey, the first Elden Lord. The age of the Erdtree began amongst conflict, when Godfrey was lord of the battlefield. He led the War against the Giants. Faced the Storm Lord, alone. And then, there came a moment. When his last worthy enemy fell. And it was then, as the story is told, that the hue of Lord Godfrey's eyes faded.

name: Envoy Crown
description: The soft bundle worn on the head by Oracle Envoys. Densely wrapped in several layers of cloth. Raises the potency of bubble-based skills. No one knows what the cloth hides, but some claim to have heard a faint whimpering from inside. It must have been their imagination.

name: Exile Hood
description: Deep red hood that covers the whole head. Worn by soldiers sent to the penal colonies, who were required to keep their faces hidden.

name: Festive Hood (altered)
description: Lighter version of the Festive Hood

name: Festive Hood
description: Hood worn by dancers at the festivities in Dominula, the village of windmills. Decorated with many-colored flowers.

name: Finger Maiden Fillet
description: Fillet worn by maidens who serve the Two Fingers. The maidens live to serve a chosen Tarnished, sharing their guidance and the wisdom of the Two Fingers. The guidance of grace would ensure that the pair be brought together. Or at least, such was the promise long ago.

name: Fire Monk Hood
description: Mail hood of iron links covering a headband engraved with flames. Attire of the Fire Monks.

name: Fire Prelate Helm
description: Helm engraved with a sacred countenance and housing a cauldron. Attire of the Fire Prelates, commanders of the Fire Monks.

name: Fia's Hood
description: Hood of black cloth that covers the whole head. Worn by Fia, the Deathbed Companion, on her journey after being exiled from her home.

name: Fingerprint Helm
description: Iron helm singed and blistered by fingers. Worn by Vyke, knight of the Roundtable Hold. No other Tarnished was closer to the throne of the Elden Lord than Vyke. But without announcement, Vyke traveled far below the capital, and was scorched by the flame of frenzy. Did he make his choice for his maiden, or did some other force lure him with suggestion?

name: Foot Soldier Cap
description: Flanged iron cap widely issued to foot soldiers in a lord's army.

name: Foot Soldier Helm
description: Wholly unembellished iron helm. Widely issued to foot soldiers in a lord's army.

name: Gilded Foot Soldier Cap
description: Flanged cap made from gilded iron. Issued to foot soldiers protecting the royal capital of Leyndell.

name: Gelmir Knight Helm
description: Helm worn by knights once loyal to Praetor Rykard. Its crest of red feathers symbolizes Rykard's pedigree as Lord Radagon's son.

name: Glintstone Scarab
description: Blue-green scarab worn directly on the head. These scarabs roll clumps of sorcery during their labors.

name: Godrick Knight Helm
description: Gauntlets worn by knights loyal to Godrick the Grafted.

name: Grass Hair Ornament
description: A headdress made from wildflowers. Wearing this might make you less easy to spot.

name: Godskin Noble Hood
description: Hood made by sewing together patches of smooth skin. Subcutaneous fat makes it plump and soft. Worn by Godskin Nobles. Nobles are the most ancient apostles who are said to have assimilated inhuman physiology. Not unilke the crucible, the Erdtree in its primordial form.

name: Foot Soldier Helmet
description: Helmet with a protective metal plate. Widely issued to foot soldiers in lord's army.

name: Godrick Soldier Helm
description: Helm worn by soldiers loyal to Godrick the Grafted. Made from durable iron, layered with a chainmail coif beneath.

name: Godskin Apostle Hood
description: Hood made by seweing together patches of smooth skin. Worn by the Godskin Apostles.

name: Great Horned Headband
description: Headband decorated by a pair of great horns.

name: Greathood
description: Hood far larger than the head it is meant to cover. A burial shroud of sorts for those who discover, at long last, the truth they sought.

name: Guilty Hood
description: Coarse hooded cloak of olive brown. The garb of those accused of lesser crimes, indicated by the collar of sharpened branches.

name: Haima Glintstone Crown
description: One of the glintstone crowns bestowed upon Raya Lucaria scholars whose pursuits were deemed worthy.

name: Guardian Mask
description: Engraved golden mask.

name: Greathelm
description: Sturdy greathelm made from iron. Though it is uncomfortably heavy and obstructs the vision of the wearer, it provides considerable damage negation.

name: Haligtree Helm
description: Helm worn by soldiers sworn to the Haligtree. An iron helm graced by a crown of unalloyed gold. Increases faith.

name: Hierodas Glintstone Crown
description: One of the glintstone crowns bestowed upon Raya Lucaria scholars whose pursuits were deemed worthy. Increases intelligence and endurance to the detriment of FP. The crown of Hierodas was granted to scholars who engaged in nomadic study away from the academy.

name: Haligtree Knight Helm
description: Helm worn by knights sworn to the Haligtree. Graced by a crown of unalloyed gold.

name: High Page Hood
description: Hood of a page selected for special privilege by the noble they serve.

name: Highwayman Hood
description: Hideously stained and ragged hood. Worn by former foot soldiers who have turned to banditry.

name: Imp Head (cat)
description: Head covering made from the largely unaltered head of an impish golem. Resembling a cat, it holds trace amounts of feline intelligence.

name: Hoslow's Helm
description: A twin-tailed silver helm decorated with flowery adornments. Symbol of the head of the head of the revered House of Hoslow.

name: Iji's Mirrorhelm
description: Helm fashioned from a crystal looking-glass, said to have never left War Counselor Iji's head. Easily broken and weak against striking attacks.

name: Imp Head (fanged)
description: Head covering made from the largely unaltered head of an impish golem. Resembling a fanged demon, it holds trace amounts of bestial strength.

name: Imp Head (corpse)
description: Head covering made from the largely unaltered head of an impish golem. Resembling the visage of a corpse, it holds trace amounts of lingering faith.

name: Imp Head (elder)
description: Head covering made from the largely unaltered head of an impish golem. Resembling an elder, it holds trace amounts of arcane knowledge.

name: Imp Head (long-tongued)
description: Head covering made from the largely unaltered head of an impish golem.

name: Imp Head (wolf)
description: Head covering made from the largely unaltered head of an impish golem. Resembling a wolf, it holds trace amounts of lupine endurance.

name: Incantation Scarab
description: Golden scarab worn directly on the head. These scarabs roll clumps of incantations during their labors. Slightly reduces the FP costs of incantations, but increases damage taken. As a scarab approaches death, it abandons its rolled treasure and stretches its wings wide for long journey to its home nest.

name: Iron Kasa
description: Iron kasa of the man who calls himself Shabriri. Crafted to imitate the woven straw hats worn in the Land of Reeds.

name: Iron Helmet
description: An iron helmet showing rust on its edges. Cloth covering the mouth and neck provides some resistance to poison and other irritants.

name: Jar
description: Jar that fits cleanly over the head when upturned. Made with pride by Iron Fist Alexander. In a uniquely jarlike gesture of friendship, it boosts the power of throwing pot items.

name: Juvenile Scholar Cap
description: Cap worn by young academy scholars, the juveniles birthed anew by the amber egg of Queen Rennala, the head of Raya Lucaria Academy. Yet their rebirth is not without imperfections, and thus do they repeat the process, eventually becoming utterly dependent upon it. Rebirth is as sleep to them, and with each awakening, memory fades into oblivion.

name: Knight Helm
description: Iron helm of an unknown knight. It is made of thin iron plate. Such metal armor is heavy, but provides considerable damage negation.

name: Land Of Reeds Helm
description: Helm made from strips of iron fastened together. Worn by warriors of the Land of Reeds. The Land of Reeds has long been locked in a miserable civil war, during which time it has remained alienated from the cultures of its neighbors. Little wonder that the entire nation has succumbed to blood-soaked madness, or so it is said.

name: Kaiden Helm
description: Helm worn by Kaiden sellswords. These hulking, fearless mercenaries, said to hail from the mountaintops of the wintry north, are adept at fighting on horseback. Kaiden is the name of their home settlement.

name: Lazuli Glintstone Crown
description: One of the glintstone crowns bestowed upon Raya Lucaria scholars whose pursuits were deemed worthy.

name: Maliketh's Helm
description: Beast's helm made of black iron and decorated with gold. Worn by Maliketh the Black Blade.

name: Lusat's Glintstone Crown
description: The giant blue glintstone crown worn by Lusat, primeval current sorcerer.

name: Leyndell Knight Helm
description: Helm worn by knights sworn to defend the royal capital of Leyndell.

name: Lionel's Helm
description: Round iron helm with a distinctive large brim. Worn by Lionel the Lionhearted.

name: Malenia's Winged Helm
description: Winged helm made of unalloyed gold.

name: Malformed Dragon Helm
description: A malformed golden helm. Adorned with various dragon imagery and worn by the misshapen Tree Sentinels.

name: Marais Mask
description: Mask in the image of a white-haired young noble. Customarily worn by the head of House Marais. Increases arcane. The Marais family has a dual history spanning generations, serving as both executioners and castellans of the Shaded Castle. This mask bears the likeness of the first of their line.

name: Marionette Soldier Helm
description: Cylindrical helm of plate metal reinforced with a lattice. Worm by marionette soldiers, crafted to serve the sorcerers.

name: Leyndell Soldier Helm
description: Helm worn by soldiers sworn to defend the royal capital of Leyndell. Made from durable iron, layered with a chainmail coif beneath.

name: Marionette Soldier Helm
description: Cylindrical helm of plate metal reinforced with a lattice. Worn by marionette soldiers, crafted to serve the sorcerers.

name: Marionette Soldier Birdhelm
description: Metal helm formed in the likeness of the face of a bird.

name: Night Maiden Twin Crown
description: Twin crowns worn by the nightmaidens of the Eternal City. Indicates the highest clerical rank, and hides the eyes with silk. Long ago, the Nox invoked the ire of the Greater Will, and were banished deep underground. Now they live under a false night sky, in eternal anticipation of their liege. Of the coming age of the stars. And their Lord of Night.

name: Mushroom Head
description: Mushrooms found growing all over the body. These overgrown mushroom have colonized the head.

name: Night's Cavalry Helm
description: Pitch-black helm with flowing black hair. Worn by the Night's Cavalry who ride funeral steeds.

name: Mask Of Confidence
description: Mask with the mouth sewn shut with gold thread. Increases arcane. When Radagon married Rennala, he ordered the Carian magic preceptors to don these masks. To make it clear that all of their matters were to be kept strictly private.

name: Navy Hood
description: A hooded cloak of deep navy. Worn by expatriated royalty. Increases mind. Such cloaks were gifted to those who departed on missions to faraway lands, from which they would never return. But what choice did they have, having seen the guidance of grace?

name: Night's Cavalry Helm (altered)
description: Lighter version of the Night's Cavalry Helm.

name: Mushroom Crown
description: Mushrooms found growing all over the body. These overgrown mushrooms form a towering headpiece. Raises attack power when something nearby suffers from poison or rot. Long ago, great lords served the scarlet rot. Perhaps such fungal bodies served as their crowns.

name: Nomadic Merchant's Chapeau
description: Chapeau of the nomadic merchants.

name: Nox Mirrorhelm
description: Helm fashioned from a crystal looking-glass. One among the Eternal City's ritual implements. Easily broken and weak against striking attacks. Worn by those committed to high treason, it wards off the intervention of the Greater Will and its vassal Fingers.

name: Nox Monk Hood
description: Silk hood worn by the monks of the Eternal City. Long ago, the Nox invoked the ire of the Greater Will, and were banished deep underground. Now they live under a false night sky, in eternal anticipation of their liege. Of the coming age of the stars. And their Lord of Night.

name: Old Aristocrat Cowl
description: Cowl made of soft cloth. Travel attire worn by nobles in the capital. Garb favored by the aged. Abandoning their birthplace after the Shattering, these undead wanderers are the pitiful product of unending life.

name: Nox Swordstress Crown
description: Crown worn by the swordstresses of the Eternal City. These women are the personal guards of the nightmaidens, and the silk hides their eyes. Long ago, the Nox invoked the ire of the Greater Will, and were banished deep underground. Now they live under a false night sky, in eternal anticipation of their liege. Of the coming age of the stars. And their Lord of Night.

name: Okina Mask
description: A wooden mask that depicts an old man bearing his teeth. The source of the sobriquet of the great swordman of the Land of Reeds. Raises dexterity as it lowers focus.

name: Nox Swordstress Crown (altered)
description: Lighter version of the Nox Swordstress Crown.

name: Nox Monk Hood (altered)
description: Lighter version of the Nox Monk Hood.

name: Octopus Head
description: A land octopus whelp worn directly on the head. Has a lingering warmth reminiscent of human skin. Those who can withstand the smell will find its organic elasticity excellent for negating strikes.

name: Omen Helm
description: Malformed helm resembling an Omen with its horns cut off.

name: Olivinus Glintstone Crown
description: One of the glintstone crowns bestowed upon Raya Lucaria scholars whose pursuits were deemed worthy. Increases intelligence to the detriment of HP. The lineage of the Olivinus Conspectus began with the sorcerer Lusat, and its adherents continue his study of meteors.

name: Perfumer Hood
description: Hood of an Erdtree Capital perfumer.

name: Omensmirk Mask
description: Mask with long, hideously twisted horns worn by the Omenkillers. Increases strength. Bears the smirking face of an elder, twisted in wicked delight. This visage is carved in the image of the evil spirits that haunt the Omen in their nightmares.

name: Preceptor's Big Hat
description: Large hat with the movements of the stars drawn on the inside of the brim. Worn by the magic preceptors who served the Carian royals.

name: Prisoner Iron Mask
description: Iron mask forced on a prisoner convicted of an appalling crime. Thick, heavy, and utterly stifling. A foul creation designed to torment the wearer, either slowly fermenting hatred within their heart, or a spiritual fervor that is near indistinguishable from it.

name: Queen's Crescent Crown
description: A tall crown depicting the moon. Worn by Rennala, Queen of the Full Moon. Increases intelligence. When Rennala, head of both the Academy of Raya Lucaria and the Carian royal family, lost her husband Radagon, her heart went along with him. And then, those at the academy realized. That Rennala was no champion, after all.

name: Radahn Soldier Helm
description: Helm worn by soldiers who fought by General Radahn's side. Its visor is fashioned after a lion's fangs.

name: Page Hood
description: Hood worn by pages who serve the nobility and are mindful to keep them out of harm's way. The unassuming sack-like appearance befits their unseen and unknown stature.

name: Prophet Blindfold
description: Blindfold of exiled prophets who foretold misfortune — and were persecuted and driven from their homes as a result. Why hesitate, if the path leading to the future is clear? Just close your eyes, and walk.

name: Pumpkin Helm
description: An oval helmet large enough to cover any head. Very heavy and very hard. Reduces damage from headshots and impacts. The inside of the helm is pitch black, keeping the crazed warrior within from panicking. Perhaps its rather roomy interior also helps alleviate feelings of pressure and claustrophobia.

name: Radahn's Redmane Helm
description: Helm of the golden lion, with flowing red hair. Worn by General Radahn.

name: Ragged Hat (altered)
description: Lighter version of the Ragged Hat.

name: Radiant Gold Mask
description: A mask designed to resemble a blazing golden halo. Created and left behind by Lord Goldmask, a staunch pursuer of Golden Order fundamentalism. Strenthens Golden Order incantations. Its striking design represents both the brilliant inspiration that once shone upon him, and the vision of a ring that he will surely find at the end of his pursuit. "To you who seek to shine as I do, wear it well!"

name: Ragged Hat
description: Helm pieced together from scavenged metal.

name: Raya Lucarian Helm
description: Helm worn by Raya Lucaria Academy soldiers. Its brow adorned with a single cuckoo's feather.

name: Rotten Duelist Helm
description: Bronze helm decorated with innumerable snakes, eaten through by scarlet rot. Worn by gladiators who were driven from the colosseum. The wearer becomes a slightly easier target for foes.

name: Royal Remains Helm
description: Helm graced with gold human bones. Worn by the unspeaking adherent of Sir Gideon the All-Knowing.

name: Royal Knight Helm
description: Silver helm of Loretta, a Knight who served Miquella's Haligtree.

name: Redmane Knight Helm
description: Helm worn by knights who fought by General Radahn's side.

name: Sacred Crown Helm
description: Flanged iron cap adorned with a crown of unalloyed gold. Increases faith. Worn by foot soldiers sworn to the Haligtree. Who is it that Miquella shall bless, if not the low and the meek?

name: Ruler's Mask
description: Mask in the image of a wizened sage. Customary dress among lords in a smaller nation. Increases faith. Such a mask illustrates the qualities of an ideal lord: chiefly, wise and possessing a certain defanged geniality. One at the center of society often finds these qualities most expedient.

name: Scaled Helm
description: Helm worn by Old Knight Istvan. The corroded metal is reinforced with rock-hard scales, making it highly effective against non-physical attacks.

name: Shining Horned Headband
description: Headband decorated by a pair of shining horns. Worn by ancestral follower shamans.

name: Sanguine Noble Hood
description: Hood of dyed black cloth featuring gold embroidery. Worn by the nobles who serve the Lord of Blood. Known to strike from pools of blood, these assassins are missionaries come to share the gospel of accursed blood.

name: Sage Hood
