description: A burgundy pointed hood. Attire of the wise sages who were deemed heretical. Evidence that the wearer was driven from town.

name: Skeletal Mask
description: Skeletal mask that tightly grips the face. Worn by the assassin's of Ravensmount.

name: Snow Witch Hat
description: Witch's pointed hat, frigid and frozen through. Of a style associated with practitioners of heretical sorcery. Strengthens cold sorcery. Once worn by the snowy crone who the young Ranni encountered deep in the woods. She was a witch, and well versed in cold sorceries. It is said that the doll that houses Ranni's soul was modeled after her. That old witch was Ranni's secret mentor.

name: Spellblade's Pointed Hat
description: Glintstone sorcerer Rogier's traveling attire, graced with an intricate, aristocratic decoration. Strengthens glintstone sorcery skills.

name: Traveling Maiden Hood
description: Hood worn by traveling maidens.

name: Silver Tear Mask
description: Mask fashioned from the corpse of a formless Silver Tear, supported by its hardened, shed husk. Greatly increases arcane to the detriment of physical attack power. To imitate the imitator is a cunning play indeed.

name: Traveler's Hat
description: Hat of a traveling perfumer of no renown.

name: Vulgar Militia Helm
description: Helm worn by lean, mean, and filthy militiamen. The upward extension serves to create an appearance of larger size, however slightly.

name: Witch's Glintstone Crown
description: One of the glintstone crowns bestowed upon Raya Lucaria scholars whose pursuits were deemed worthy.

name: Twinsage Glintstone Crown
description: One of the glintstone crowns bestowed upon Raya Lucaria scholars whose pursuits were deemed worthy. Greatly increases intelligence to the detriment of HP and stamina. Scholars of the Twinsage Conspectus were the elites of the academy, permitted to study and excel in sorceries of all kinds.

name: Veteran's Helm
description: An old helm that has seen many battles.Worn by Niall, the great veteran general of Sol.

name: White Mask
description: Bloodstained, faintly grinning mask. Worn by war surgeons who were effectively mercy killers. The Lord of Blood's curse enlivens the wearer when bloodletting occurs. Slightly raises attack power when there is blood loss nearby.

name: Tree Sentinel Helm
description: Golden helm of the heavy cavalry Tree Sentinels who serve the Erdtree.

name: Twinned Helm
description: Helm depicting entwined twins of gold and silver.

name: Vagabond Knight Helm
description: Helm of a knight banished from their motherland. Dirty and battered after enduring a lengthy vagabond journey.

name: Zamor Mask
description: Mask worn by knights of Zamor, hailed as heroes in the War against the Giants. These long-lived warriors, clad in biting, freezing winds, are said to have been the mortal enemies of the Fire Giants since time immemorial.

name: Astrologer Trousers
description: Trousers worn inside a robe. Worn by those who look to the cosmos above. They read fate in the stars, and are said to be heirs of the glintstone sorcerers. But alas, the night sky no longer cradles fate.

name: Bandit Boots
description: Leather boots worn by bandits.

name: Battlemage Legwraps
description: Legwraps worn by the scholars of the Raya Lucaria Academy, tattered from being worn on the battlefield.

name: Alberich's Trousers
description: Mad Tongue Alberich's trousers.

name: Aristocrat Boots
description: Boots made from tanned leather. Travel attire worn by nobles in the capital. Abandoning their birthplace after the shattering, these undead wanderers are the pitiful product of unending life.

name: Banished Knight Greaves
description: Thick, full set of armor covering the entire body. These greaves were worn by knights who, whether by misfortune or misdeed, were forced to abandon their homes. These fierce warriors were each and all accomplished. Perhaps that is why, despite their territorial losses, they were still named knights.

name: Blackflame Monk Greave
description: Black iron greaves featuring a flame motif.

name: Beast Champion Greaves
description: Silver greaves engraved with tiny beasts. Worn by Bernahl the Recusant.

name: Black Knife Greaves
description: Greaves used by the Black Knife Assassins. Crafted with scale armor that makes no sound. The assassins that carried out the deeds of the Night of the Black Knives were all women, and rumored to be Numen who had close ties with Marika herself.

name: Blaidd's Greaves
description: Well-worn black greaves of the man-wolf Blaidd.

name: Cleanrot Greaves
description: Greaves of the Cleanrot Knights, celebrated for their undefeated campaign in the Shattering.

name: Blue Silver Mail Skirt
description: Chainmail skirt crafted with blue silver. Worn by the wolf-riding Albinauric archers.

name: Briar Greaves
description: Battered iron greaves from a foreign land. Worn by Elemer of the Briar.

name: Brave's Legwraps
description: Greaves wrapped in thick leather. Garb worn by warriors of the frigid uplands. Has a fur lining which excels at keeping the cold at bay.

name: Commoner's Shoes
description: Modest shoes made of cloth. Standard wear for commoners of the Lands Between. Only, there are no commoners remaining with their wits about them.

name: Carian Knight Greaves
description: Greaves of the enchanted knights that once served the Carian royal family. The enchanted knights, anointed by the Lunar Queen, were all decorated heroes, were heroes of the highest honors, but fell into disarray with the decline of the royal family.

name: Cloth Trousers
description: Trousers made of coarse material, commonly worn in the Lands Between.

name: Chain Leggings
description: Leggings made of woven chain. Standard issue for ordinary soldiers. Though plain in appearance, they offer dependable protection.

name: Bloodhound Knight Greaves
description: Metal greaves of the Bloodhound Knights. The Bloodhound Knights are trained as hunters and known to be unshakable trackers. Without the use of language, each knight chooses his own master. Once the decision has been made the knight stays loyal for life.

name: Bull-goat Greaves
description: Great Horned Tragoth's greaves. Covers its wearer with a pair of giant horns, providing staunch poise.

name: Cuckoo Knight Greaves
description: Greaves worn by Raya Lucaria Academy knights. Time has yet to dull their luster.

name: Crucible Greaves
description: Greaves of the Crucible Knights who served Godfrey, the first Elden Lord. Hold the power of the crucible of life, the primordial form of the Erdtree. Strengthen Aspects of the Crucible incantations. In time, the strength shown by these knights, and even their appearance, was seen as chaotic and deserving of scorn.

name: Confessor Boots
description: Leather boots of the church confessors. The churches outside the Lands Between, dedicated to the teachings of the Two Fingers, send confessors out to follow the guidance of grace. The confessors are loyal servants to the Two Fingers, ready to hunt down and quietly dispose of their enemies.

name: Drake Knight Greaves
description: Greaves wrapped in thick leather. Garb worn by warriors of the frigid uplands. Has a fur lining which excels at keeping the cold at bay.

name: Consort's Trousers
description: Fine white trousers, perfectly suited for wearing beneath a silk robe.

name: Deathbed Smalls
description: Skirt worn by Phia, the Deathbed Companion.

name: Eccentric's Breeches
description: The knight Jerren's breeches. Jerren preferred a nomadic existence, but after spending time as a guest of the Carian royals, he became the guest commander for General Radahn. And for the first time, the restless tumbleweed would be bound by honorable oath.

name: Duelist Greaves
description: Greaves encircles by bronze snakes. Worn by gladiators who were driven from the colosseum. The wearer becomes a slightly easier target for foes. The snake is viewed as a traitor to the Erdtree, and the audience delighted in seeing these bronze effigies beaten and battered.

name: Elden Lord Greaves
description: Greaves of Godfrey, the first Elden Lord. The age of the Erdtree began amongst conflict, when Godfrey was lord of the battlefield. He led the War against the Giants. Faced the Storm Lord, alone. And then, there came a moment. When his last worthy enemy fell. And it was then, as the story is told, that the hue of Lord Godfrey's eyes faded.

name: Depraved Perfumer Trousers
description: Trousers worn by depraved perfumers.

name: Errant Sorcerer Boots
description: Commonplace leather boots, sturdy enough to withstand a long journey.

name: Fire Prelate Greaves
description: Black iron greaves with the appearance of flames. Attire of the Fire Prelates, commanders of the Fire Monks.

name: Fur Leggings
description: Leggings fashioned from bristly pelts. Worn by ancestral follower warriors. The ancestral followers keep their distance from the Erdtree, awaiting new buds. They are certain to sprout from their very flesh, and indeed, their souls.

name: Fingerprint Greaves
description: Iron greaves singed and blistered by fingers. Worn by Vyke, knight of the Roundtable Hold. No other Tarnished was closer to the throne of the Elden Lord than Vyke. But without announcement, Vyke traveled far below the capital, and was scorched by the flame of frenzy. Did he make his choice for his maiden, or did some other force lure him with suggestion?

name: Finger Maiden Shoes
description: Shoes worn by maidens who serve the Two Fingers. The maidens live to serve a chosen Tarnished, sharing their guidance and the wisdom of the Two Fingers. The guidance of grace would ensure that the pair be brought together. Or at least, such was the promise long ago.

name: Exile Greaves
description: Damaged iron greaves. Worn by soldiers sent to the penal colonies.

name: Foot Soldier Greaves
description: Metal Graves that have already been mended countless times. Widely issued to foot soldiers in a lord's army.

name: Gelmir Knight Greaves
description: Greaves worn by knights once loyal to Praetor Rykard. Time has yet to dull their luster.

name: Godrick Knight Greaves
description: Greaves worn by knights loyal to Godrick the Grafted. Time has yet to dull their luster.

name: Fire Monk Greaves
description: Black iron greaves featuring a flame motif. Attire of the Fire Monks.

name: Godrick Soldier Greaves
description: Greaves worn by soldiers loyal to Godrick the Grafted. Rust-worn and stained through unending conflict.

name: Gold Waistwrap
description: Waistwrap made in the image of Erdtree branches. A minimal adornment made by Lord Goldmask's disciples. Those disciples have long since left him.

name: Haligtree Knight Greaves
description: Greaves worn by knights sworn to the Haligtree. Time has yet to dull their luster.

name: Godskin Apostle Trousers
description: Trousers made by seweing together patches of smooth skin.

name: Hoslow's Greaves
description: Garish silver greaves decorated with red embellishments. Passed down through the Hoslow family.

name: Haligtree Greaves
description: Greaves worn by soldiers sworn to the Haligtree. Rust-worn and stained through unending conflict.

name: Godskin Noble Trousers
description: Trousers made by sewing together patches of smooth skin. Subcutaneous fat makes them plump and soft. Worn by Godskin Nobles. Nobles are the most ancient apostles who are said to have assimilated inhuman physiology. Not unlike the crucible, the Erdtree in its primordial form.

name: Guardian Greaves
description: Engraved golden greaves. Worn by the guardians of the Minor Erdtrees.

name: Kaiden Trousers
description: Trousers worn by Kaiden sellswords.

name: Knight Greaves
description: Iron greaves of an unknown knight. It is made of thin iron plate. Such metal armor is heavy, but provides considerable damage negation.

name: Land Of Reeds Greaves
description: Greaves wrapped in tough leather.

name: Leather Boots
description: Lightweight and battle-proven leather boots worn by a savvy soldier. Many admire the wearer of this armor for his chivalrous and forthright spirit.

name: Leather Trousers
description: Well-made leather trousers. The lower legs are each bound in cord for ease of movement.

name: Leyndell Knight Greaves
description: Greaves worn by knights sworn to defend the royal capital of Leyndell. Time has yet to dull their luster.

name: Leyndell Soldier Greaves
description: Greaves worn by soldiers sworn to defend the royal capital of Leyndell. Rust-worn and stained through unending conflict.

name: Lionel's Greaves
description: Rounded iron greaves. Worn by Lionel the Lionhearted.

name: Malformed Dragon Greaves
description: Malformed golden greaves.

name: Malenia's Greaves
description: Greaves made of unalloyed gold. Worn by Malenia, Blade of Miquella. Malenia awaited Miquella at the foot of the husk. "My brother will keep his promise. He possesses the wisdom, the allure, of a god—he is the most fearsome Empyrean of all."

name: Maliketh's Greaves
description: Beast's greaves made of black iron and decorated with gold. Worn by Maliketh the Black Blade. Maliketh, Queen Marika's loyal half-brother, bore a blade imbued with Destined Death, and there was not one demigod who did not fear him. Champions knew what was at stake. Indeed, that is what made them champions.

name: Mausoleum Greaves
description: Greaves worn by headless soldiers who endlessly guard the Wandering Museum. Rust-worn and stained through unending conflict.

name: Mausoleum Knight Greaves
description: Greaves worn by headless knights who endlessly guard the Wandering Mausoleum. Time has yet to dull their luster.

name: Old Sorcerer Legwraps
description: Ragged waistcloth that extends to the thighs. Common amongst old-fashioned sorcerers.

name: Nox Monk Greaves
description: Greaves worn by the monks of the Eternal City. Long ago, the Nox invoked the ire of the Greater Will, and were banished deep underground. Now they live under a false night sky, in eternal anticipation of their liege. Of the coming age of the stars. And their Lord of Night.

name: Omenkiller Boots
description: Long, stiff leather gloves worn by the Omenkillers.

name: Nomadic Merchant's Trousers
description: Trousers of the nomadic merchants. These merchants once thrived as the Great Caravan, but after being accused of heretical beliefs, their entire clan was rounded up and buried alive far underground. Then, they chanted a curse of despair, and summoned the flame of frenzy.

name: Page Trousers
description: Trousers worn by pages who serve nobility and are mindful to keep them out of harm's way.

name: Night's Cavalry Greaves
description: Pitch-black greaves thinly painted with dried blood. Worn by the Night's Cavalry who ride funeral steeds.

name: Mushroom Legs
description: Mushrooms found growing all over the body. These overgrown mushroom have colonized the Legs.  To those enraptured by the scarlet rot, they are holy vestments that root one to the earth.

name: Omen Greaves
description: Malformed greaves resembling an Omen with its horns cut off.

name: Old Aristocrat Shoes
description: Hard-wearing shoes made of leather. Travel attire worn by nobles in the capital. Garb favored by the aged.

name: Noble's Trousers
description: White trousers of superior craftsmanship. Worn by expatriated royalty. A gift of such rare beauty, a royal wouldn't disgrace their illustrious heritage even if found dead, in a ditch, in the middle of nowhere, while wearing such splendid raiment.

name: Ragged Loincloth
description: Greaves pieced together from scavenged metal.

name: Perfumer Sarong
description: Sarong of an Erdtree Capital perfumer.

name: Preceptor's Trousers
description: Trousers of the magic preceptors who serve the Carian royals. Black and perfectly discreet.

name: Prophet Trousers
description: Trousers of the exiled prophets who foresaw that their faith would end in flames — and were persecuted and driven from their homes as a result. Its fabric scrapes against their skin like a file, and the rickety cart wheel around the neck warns passers-by not to lend an ear to their meandering sermons.

name: Queen's Leggings
description: Leggings indicating the highest order of sorcerer. Worn by Rennala, Queen of the Full Moon. When Rennala, head of both the Academy of Raya Lucaria and the Carian royal family, lost her husband Radagon, her heart went along with him. And then, those at the academy realized. That Rennala was no champion, after all.

name: Raya Lucarian Greaves
description: Greaves worn by Raya Lucaria Academy soldiers. Rust-worn and stained through unending conflict.

name: Prisoner Trousers
description: Tattered trousers. Worn by a prisoner convicted of an appalling crime. Never once washed, every fiber is filthy. The smell is beyond belief.

name: Redmane Knight Greaves
description: Black iron greaves worn by knights who fought by General Radahn's side. Time has yet to dull their luster.

name: Radahn's Greaves
description: Greaves depicting the golden lion. Worn by General Radahn.

name: Radahn Soldier Greaves
description: Greaves worn by soldiers who fought by General Radahn's side. Rust-worn and stained through unending conflict.

name: Royal Knight Greaves
description: Silver greaves of Loretta, a knight who served Miquella's Haligtree. Loretta, once a royal Carian knight, went on a journey in search of a haven for Albinaurics, and determined that the Haligtree was their best chance for eventual salvation.

name: Ronin's Greaves
description: Greaves of the man who calls himself Shabriri. Highly functional and heavily worn.

name: Royal Remains Greaves
description: Greaves graced with gold human bones. Worn by the unspeaking adherent of Sir Gideon the All-Knowing.

name: Sage Trousers
description: Thick burgundy trousers. Attire of the wise sages who were deemed heretical. Evidence that the wearer was driven from town.

name: Shaman Leggings
description: Leggings fashioned from bristly pelts. Worn by ancestral follower shamans.

name: Snow Witch Skirt
description: Witch's skirt in the color of snow. Once worn by the snowy crone who the young Ranni encountered deep in the woods. She was a witch, and well versed in cold sorceries. It is said that the doll that houses Ranni's soul was modeled after her. That old witch was Ranni's secret mentor.

name: Scaled Greaves
description: Gauntlets worn by Old Knight Istvan. The corroded metal is reinforced with rock-hard scales, making it high effective against non-physical attacks. Istvan is one of a few wizened Tarnished who survived to this day.

name: Rotten Duelist Greaves
description: Greaves wrapped with bronze snakes, eaten through by scarlet rot. Worn by gladiators who were driven from the colosseum. The wearer becomes a slightly easier target for foes.

name: Spellblade's Trousers
description: Glintstone sorcerer Rogier's traveling attire, graced with an intricate, aristocratic decoration. Strengthens glintstone sorcery skills.

name: Sorcerer Leggings
description: Leggings worn by Raya Lucaria's magic scholars. Made by wrapping a simple cloth around the legs.

name: Traveler's Slops
description: Slops of a traveling perfumer of no renown.

name: Veteran's Greaves
description: An old greaves that has seen many battles.Worn by Niall, the great veteran general of Sol.

name: Traveler's Boots
description: Light yet sturdy leather boots.

name: Traveling Maiden Boots
description: Boots worn by traveling maidens.

name: Twinned Greaves
description: Greaves depicting entwined twins of gold and silver.

name: Tree Sentinel Greaves
description: Golden greaves of the heavy cavalry Tree Sentinels who serve the Erdtree.

name: War Surgeon Trousers
description: Bloodstained trousers of the war surgeons who were effectively mercy killers. Of the surgeons that were abducted by the Lord of Blood none were able to tame the accursed blood. None but Varré, that is; though he was an exception

name: Vulgar Militia Greaves
description: Greaves worn by lean, mean, and filthy militiamen.

name: Warrior Greaves
description: Greaves of a nomadic warrior. Crafted from sturdy leather.

name: Vagabond Knight Greaves
description: Greaves of a knight banished from their motherland. Dirty and battered after enduring a lengthy vagabond journey.

name: White Reed Greaves
description: Greaves of the White Reeds, fashioned from banded iron plates. Worn by the Inabam head disciples of the great swordsman Okina. The Inaba traveled in pursuit of not only the master who abandoned them, but also proper deaths, won honorably through hard-fought combat. To be a White Reed is to seek death; fitting for the Inaba, who desired nothingmore than to die by the sword.

name: Zamor Legwraps
description: Legwraps worn by knights of Zamor, hailed as heroes in the War against the Giants. These long-lived warriors, clad in biting, freezing winds, are said to have been the mortal enemies of the Fire Giants since time immemorial.
